intro: Galium megalospermum subsp. cometerhizon, commonly known as the broad-leaved bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Galium megalospermum subsp. cometerhizon typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
